actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that increases in monthly insurance benefits thereunder (whether occurring by reason of increases in the cost of living or enacted by law) shall not be considered as annual income for purposes of certain other benefit programs.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides that increases in monthly insurance benefits under the Federal Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance program of the Social Security Act (whether occurring by reason of increases in the cost of living or enacted by law) shall not be considered as annual income for purposes of calculation of the amounts to be paid under veterans' pension programs or as dependency and indemnity compensation to the parents of deceased veterans.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that increases in monthly insurance benefits thereunder (whether occurring by reason of increases in the cost of living or enacted by law) shall not be considered as annual income for purposes of certain other benefit programs.
